speaker: ACHILLES
text:
I’ll
               
              heat
               
              his
               
              blood
               
              with
               
              Greekish
               
              wine
               
              tonight
              ,

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Which
               
              with
               
              my
               
              scimitar
               
              I’ll
               
              cool
               
              tomorrow
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Patroclus
              ,
               
              let
               
              us
               
              feast
               
              him
               
              to
               
              the
               
              height
              .

speaker: PATROCLUS
text:
Here
               
              comes
               
              Thersites
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
How
               
              now
              ,
               
              thou
               
              core
               
              of
               
              envy
              ?

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Thou
               
              crusty
               
              botch
               
              of
               
              nature
              ,
               
              what’s
               
              the
               
              news
              ?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Why, thou picture of what thou seemest and

speaker: THERSITES
text: idol of idiot-worshippers, here’s a letter for thee.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: From whence, fragment?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Why, thou full dish of fool, from Troy.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: Who keeps the tent now?

speaker: THERSITES
text: The surgeon’s box or the patient’s wound.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: Well said, adversity. And what need these

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: tricks?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Prithee, be silent, boy. I profit not by thy

speaker: THERSITES
text: talk. Thou art said to be Achilles’ male varlet.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: “Male varlet,” you rogue! What’s that?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Why, his masculine whore. Now the rotten

speaker: THERSITES
text: diseases of the south, the guts-griping, ruptures,

speaker: THERSITES
text: catarrhs, loads o’ gravel in the back, lethargies,

speaker: THERSITES
text: cold palsies, raw eyes, dirt-rotten livers, whissing

speaker: THERSITES
text: lungs, bladders full of impostume, sciaticas,

speaker: THERSITES
text: limekilns i’ th’ palm, incurable bone-ache, and the

speaker: THERSITES
text: rivelled fee-simple of the tetter, take and take

speaker: THERSITES
text: again such preposterous discoveries.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: Why, thou damnable box of envy, thou,

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: what means thou to curse thus?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Do I curse thee?

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: Why, no, you ruinous butt, you whoreson

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: indistinguishable cur, no.

speaker: THERSITES
text: No? Why art thou then exasperate, thou idle

speaker: THERSITES
text: immaterial skein of sleave-silk, thou green sarsenet

speaker: THERSITES
text: flap for a sore eye, thou tassel of a prodigal’s purse,

speaker: THERSITES
text: thou? Ah, how the poor world is pestered with such

speaker: THERSITES
text: waterflies, diminutives of nature!

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: Out, gall!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Finch egg!

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
My
               
              sweet
               
              Patroclus
              ,
               
              I
               
              am
               
              thwarted
               
              quite

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
From
               
              my
               
              great
               
              purpose
               
              in
               
              tomorrow’s
               
              battle
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Here
               
              is
               
              a
               
              letter
               
              from
               
              Queen
               
              Hecuba
              ,

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
A
               
              token
               
              from
               
              her
               
              daughter
              ,
               
              my
               
              fair
               
              love
              ,

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Both
               
              taxing
               
              me
               
              and
               
              gaging
               
              me
               
              to
               
              keep

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
An
               
              oath
               
              that
               
              I
               
              have
               
              sworn
              .
               
              I
               
              will
               
              not
               
              break
               
              it
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Fall
              ,
               
              Greeks
              ;
               
              fail
              ,
               
              fame
              ;
               
              honor
              ,
               
              or
               
              go
               
              or
               
              stay
              ;

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
My
               
              major
               
              vow
               
              lies
               
              here
              ;
               
              this
               
              I’ll
               
              obey
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Come
              ,
               
              come
              ,
               
              Thersites
              ,
               
              help
               
              to
               
              trim
               
              my
               
              tent
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
This
               
              night
               
              in
               
              banqueting
               
              must
               
              all
               
              be
               
              spent
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Away
              ,
               
              Patroclus
              .

speaker: THERSITES
text: With too much blood and too little brain,

speaker: THERSITES
text: these two may run mad; but if with too much brain

speaker: THERSITES
text: and too little blood they do, I’ll be a curer of madmen.

speaker: THERSITES
text: Here’s Agamemnon, an honest fellow enough

speaker: THERSITES
text: and one that loves quails, but he has not so much

speaker: THERSITES
text: brain as earwax. And the goodly transformation

speaker: THERSITES
text: of Jupiter there, his brother, the bull—the primitive

speaker: THERSITES
text: statue and oblique memorial of cuckolds, a

speaker: THERSITES
text: thrifty shoeing-horn in a chain, hanging at his

speaker: THERSITES
text: brother’s leg—to what form but that he is should

speaker: THERSITES
text: wit larded with malice and malice forced with

speaker: THERSITES
text: wit turn him to? To an ass were nothing; he is both

speaker: THERSITES
text: ass and ox. To an ox were nothing; he is both ox

speaker: THERSITES
text: and ass. To be a dog, a mule, a cat, a fitchew, a

speaker: THERSITES
text: toad, a lizard, an owl, a puttock, or a herring without

speaker: THERSITES
text: a roe, I would not care; but to be Menelaus! I

speaker: THERSITES
text: would conspire against destiny. Ask me not what I

speaker: THERSITES
text: would be, if I were not Thersites, for I care not to be

speaker: THERSITES
text: the louse of a lazar so I were not Menelaus.

speaker: THERSITES
text: Heyday! Sprites and fires!

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text: We go wrong, we go wrong.

speaker: AJAX
text:
No
              ,
               
              yonder
              —
              ’tis
               
              there
              ,
               
              where
               
              we
               
              see
               
              the
               
              lights
              .

speaker: HECTOR
text:
I
               
              trouble
               
              you
              .

speaker: AJAX
text:
No
              ,
               
              not
               
              a
               
              whit
              .

speaker: ULYSSES
text:
Here
               
              comes
               
              himself
               
              to
               
              guide
               
              you
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Welcome
              ,
               
              brave
               
              Hector
              .
               
              Welcome
              ,
               
              princes
               
              all
              .

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text:
So
               
              now
              ,
               
              fair
               
              prince
               
              of
               
              Troy
              ,
               
              I
               
              bid
               
              good
               
              night
              .

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text:
Ajax
               
              commands
               
              the
               
              guard
               
              to
               
              tend
               
              on
               
              you
              .

speaker: HECTOR
text:
Thanks
              ,
               
              and
               
              good
               
              night
               
              to
               
              the
               
              Greeks’
               
              general
              .

speaker: MENELAUS
text:
Good
               
              night
              ,
               
              my
               
              lord
              .

speaker: HECTOR
text:
Good
               
              night
              ,
               
              sweet
               
              lord
               
              Menelaus
              .

speaker: THERSITES
text: Sweet draught. “Sweet,” quoth he?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Sweet sink, sweet sewer.

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Good
               
              night
               
              and
               
              welcome
              ,
               
              both
               
              at
               
              once
              ,
               
              to
               
              those

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
That
               
              go
               
              or
               
              tarry
              .

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text:
Good
               
              night
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Old
               
              Nestor
               
              tarries
              ,
               
              and
               
              you
               
              too
              ,
               
              Diomed
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Keep
               
              Hector
               
              company
               
              an
               
              hour
               
              or
               
              two
              .

speaker: DIOMEDES
text:
I
               
              cannot
              ,
               
              lord
              .
               
              I
               
              have
               
              important
               
              business
              ,

speaker: DIOMEDES
text:
The
               
              tide
               
              whereof
               
              is
               
              now
              .
              —
              Good
               
              night
              ,
               
              great
               
              Hector
              .

speaker: HECTOR
text:
Give
               
              me
               
              your
               
              hand
              .

speaker: ULYSSES
text:
Follow
               
              his
               
              torch
              ;
               
              he
               
              goes
               
              to
               
              Calchas’
               
              tent
              .

speaker: ULYSSES
text:
I’ll
               
              keep
               
              you
               
              company
              .

speaker: TROILUS
text:
Sweet
               
              sir
              ,
               
              you
               
              honor
               
              me
              .

speaker: HECTOR
text:
And
               
              so
              ,
               
              good
               
              night
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Come
              ,
               
              come
              ,
               
              enter
               
              my
               
              tent
              .

speaker: THERSITES
text: That same Diomed’s a false-hearted rogue,

speaker: THERSITES
text: a most unjust knave. I will no more trust him when

speaker: THERSITES
text: he leers than I will a serpent when he hisses. He

speaker: THERSITES
text: will spend his mouth and promise like Brabbler

speaker: THERSITES
text: the hound, but when he performs, astronomers

speaker: THERSITES
text: foretell it; it is prodigious, there will come some

speaker: THERSITES
text: change. The sun borrows of the moon when

speaker: THERSITES
text: Diomed keeps his word. I will rather leave to see

speaker: THERSITES
text: Hector than not to dog him. They say he keeps a

speaker: THERSITES
text: Trojan drab and uses the traitor Calchas his tent.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I’ll after. Nothing but lechery! All incontinent varlets!
